AUS.tip: CANberra is where they CAN govern Australia

BRA.tip: Brazil moved its capital to Brasília from Rio - they named it after themselves!

CAN.tip: Ottawa sounds like 'Oh, TWO' - Canada's second language is French

TUR.tip: Turkey's capital ANKara sounds like 'anchor' - anchored in the middle of the country

CHE.tip: BERN is where Swiss chocolate BURNs on your tongue - it's that good!

USA.tip: WASH-ington - where they 'wash' their dirty political laundry

NZL.tip: Wellington sounds like 'wellies' - boots for the rainy New Zealand weather

MYS.tip: Kuala LUMPur - imagine a LUMP of gold in Malaysia

ZAF.tip: PREtoria - it's the PREmier administrative capital of South Africa

IND.tip: NEW Delhi - they built a NEW capital next to OLD Delhi

PAK.tip: ISLAMabad - named for ISLAM, Pakistan's main religion

MMR.tip: Nay Pyi Taw is a brand NEW capital - built in 2006!

KAZ.tip: ASTana → NUR-Sultan → ASTANA again - it's had many names like Kazakhstan's flag changes

AUT.tip: VIENna - think of Vienna WALTZES, the famous dance

HUN.tip: BUDApest = BUDA + PEST, two cities merged by a bridge

NLD.tip: AmsterDAM - built on a DAM on the Amstel river

IRL.tip: DUBLIN - DUB sounds like pub, the Irish love their pubs!

SWE.tip: STOCKholm - like a 'stock' of IKEA furniture

NOR.tip: OSLO sounds like 'OZ-low' - it's at a low point on the fjord

DNK.tip: COPENhagen - where you COPE with the cold Danish winters

FIN.tip: HELsinki - sounds like HELL-sinky, but it's actually quite nice!

POL.tip: WARsaw - where WARS were fought in WWII

CZE.tip: PRAGUE rhymes with 'vague' - the foggy old city

GRC.tip: ATHENS - where ATHletes competed in the first Olympics

ITA.tip: ROME - all roads lead there, as they say!

ESP.tip: MADrid - where you go MAD for tapas and football

PRT.tip: LISbon - LIS sounds like 'list' - list Portugal's oldest city

FRA.tip: PARIS - where you meet a 'pair' of lovers by the Eiffel Tower

DEU.tip: BERLIN - the WALL was 'built-in' during the Cold War

GBR.tip: LONDON - home of the LONgest-reigning monarchy

RUS.tip: MOSCOW - sounds like 'MOS-cow' - where Russian bears roam!

CHN.tip: BeiJING means 'Northern Capital' in Chinese - JINGdu means capital

JPN.tip: TOKYO means 'Eastern Capital' - it's east of the old capital Kyoto

KOR.tip: SEOUL sounds like 'soul' - the heart and SOUL of Korea

THA.tip: BANGKOK - think of loud BANGS from fireworks during Thai festivals

VNM.tip: HANOI - 'ha-NOI' rhymes with 'enjoy' in a French accent

IDN.tip: JAKARTA is on JAVA island - like Java coffee!

PHL.tip: MANILA folders! The color was inspired by Manila hemp from Philippines

EGY.tip: CAIRO sounds like 'care-oh' - take CARE around the pyramids!

NGA.tip: ABUJA is in the center - they ABU-it (built it) to be central!

KEN.tip: NAIROBI - NAI sounds like 'nigh' - lions are always nearby

ETH.tip: ADDIS ABABA means 'new flower' - it's at a high altitude

MAR.tip: RABAT sounds like 'rabbit' - picture rabbits in Morocco

MEX.tip: MEXICO City - named after the country, they kept it simple!

ARG.tip: BUENOS AIRES means 'good airs' - fresh breezes from the river

PER.tip: LIMA sounds like 'lima bean' - Peru grows lots of beans!

COL.tip: BOGOTÁ - think of Colombian COFFEE and you'll remember BO-go-TA

CHL.tip: SANTIAGO - named after Saint James (Santiago in Spanish)

VEN.tip: CARACAS - sounds like 'car-AH-cas' - picture cars in Venezuela
